newsitem.title: USA: ADVISORY - Chicago exchanges' holiday hours.
newsitem.headline: ADVISORY - Chicago exchanges' holiday hours.

text.p: Chicago exchanges said they will observe the following schedules for the U.S. Labor Day holiday on Monday, September 2.
The Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME), the Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT) and the Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE) day trading sessions will be closed on Monday.
The CBOT's overnight Project A and evening pit sessions will be open on Monday, but the afternoon Project A will be closed.
On Friday, August 30, all CME contracts will close at 1200 CDT/1700 GMT, except Goldman Sachs Commodity Index and equity index products, which will trade their normal hours.
At the CBOT, financial and catastrophe insurance products will close at 1210 CDT/1710 GMT on Friday, but all other contracts will trade normal hours.
CBOE's interest-rate options will close at 1200 CDT/1700 GMT on Friday, but individual equity options and equity index options will trade normal hours.
On Sunday, September 1, CBOT's night pit session will be closed.
GLOBEX trading will open on Sunday at 1730 CDT/2230 GMT and will continue trading until 0815 CDT/1315 GMT on Tuesday, September 3.
